did.abstract: Collection contains administrative files of the Program in Comparative Studies on South Asia.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Program in Comparative Studies on South Asia Records were received by the Duke University Archives as a transfer in March, 2006.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Program in Comparative Studies on South Asia, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this finding aid: UA89-0075, UA78-119, UA75-76

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Established in 1961 under a Ford Foundation grant to the Commonwealth Studies Center, the Program in Comparative Studies at Duke was set up to facilitate research on, and the training of graduate students in the political, historical, economic, and sociocultural development of Commonwealth countries in Southern Asia. A South Asia center was established in 1963. The program was housed in the International Studies Center and supported and administered through the Office of the Vice Provost for International Studies.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records relating to the administrative activities and courses taught under the auspices of the Program in Comparative Studies on Southern Asia between the mid-1960s and mid-1970s. Included are syllabi, course materials, publicity, financial records, office records, symposium records, grant applications, faculty data, and correspondence.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for official University Records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Detailed course information, as well as course material packets. Bound.
